name: Yuanyi Zhong
body:
## Research Interests
Human and artificial intelligence/cognition (and their interaction), machine learning, computer vision, and cognitive science

***

## Education
### Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
* B.Eng., Electronic Engineering, Expected: Summer 2017
* GPA: 92.3/100, rank: 5/195
### Rice University, Houston, Texas, USA
* Exchange Student, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Fall 2015
* GPA: 4.17 (A+ corresponds to 4.33)

***

## Publications
1. Jing Zhang, Jie Tang, **Yuanyi Zhong**, Yuchen Mo, Jimeng Sun and Juanzi Li. \StructInf: Mining Structural Influence from Social Streams". In Proceedings of the 31st AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI'17). [[PDF](http://keg.cs.tsinghua.edu.cn/jietang/publications/AAAI17-Zhang-et-al-structural-influence.pdf), [ProjectPage](http://cn.aminer.org/structinf)]
2. **Yuanyi Zhong**, Jiansheng Chen, Bo Huang. (title hidden due to anonymity) about CNN-based end-to-end face recognition by learning face alignment with a Spatial Transformer. under review for CVPR 2017

***

## Research Experiences
### Kanwisher Lab
Brain and Cognitive Sciences, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, MA  
July - Aug 2016  
Supervisor: Nancy Kanwisher, Ph.D; Collaborator: Matthew Peterson, Ph.D.
#### Project: Real World Retinal Image Statistics (Ongoing)
* Applying computer vision, deep learning and electronic engineering techniques,
to build a real-world retinal image collecting and eye tracking system, and
to test hypotheses regarding human visual cognition models, such as face
perception and individualized visual attention models.
![Prototype system with SMI eye-tracking glass](http://mikuhatsune.github.io/eyetrack1.png)
Prototype system with SMI eye-tracking glass
![Saliency/human fixation prediction](http://mikuhatsune.github.io/eyetrack2.png)
Saliency/human fixation prediction

___

### Center for Intelligent Image and Document Processing
Electronic Engineering, Tsinghua University  
Jan 2016 - Present  
Supervisor: Jiansheng Chen, Ph.D.
#### Project: CNN-based Face Detection, Alignment, and Recognition
* Proposing an end-to-end face recognition system that learns alignment by itself,
and a multi-task face detection network achieved by fine-tuning GoogLeNet
(paper submitted to CVPR'17)
* Collaborating with a company on deploying the proposed systems into products

___

### Knowledge Engineering Group (KEG)
Computer Science, Tsinghua University  
Nov 2014 - Mar 2016  
Supervisor: Jie Tang, Ph.D.
#### Project 1: Modeling Social Network Users via Deep Learning
* Studied the problem of learning latent vector representations of users by
neural network embedding, as inspired by word2vec, and making link predictions;
* Out-performed baseline matrix factorization method (AUC +5%)
![](http://mikuhatsune.github.io/graphembed2.png)
![](http://mikuhatsune.github.io/graphembed_link.png)

#### Project 2: Mining Structural Influence from Social Streams
(collaboration with Jing Zhang, Ph.D.) URL: http://cn.aminer.org/structinf
* Introduced the notion of structural influence on social networks;
* Presented the exact and approximate algorithms to discover influence patterns;
* My contribution: implementing the algorithm in C++, conducting experiments on Weibo data, and analyzing the results and error bounds.
![](http://mikuhatsune.github.io/structinf_algo.png)
![](http://mikuhatsune.github.io/structureinfluence.png)

___

### Efficient Computing Group (RECG)
Electrical and Computer Engineering, Rice University  
Sept 2015 - Dec 2015  
Supervisor: Lin Zhong, Ph.D.
#### Project: Hacked into the ARM Cortex M3 hidden processor on BeagleBoneBlack embedded programming board; examined related security issues.

***

## Other Projects

***

## Awards
* Nov 2016  National Scholarship
* Nov 2015  Scholarship for top Electronic Engineering students, Tsinghua
* Jun 2015  Study Abroad Scholarship, China Scholarship Council
* Dec 2014  Third Prize in Beijing College Student Physics Competition
* Nov 2014  Scholarship for top students sponsored by EMC Corp.
* Dec 2013  Ranked 4th in the 15th EE Artificial Intelligence Contest

***

## Student Activities
* May 2015 - Present    Member, Tsinghua Spark Talents Program club
* Aug 2015 - Aug 2015   Member, Spark industry investigation trip to Japan
* Jan 2015 - Jun 2016   Deputy Minister, Student Association of Science and Technology, Department of Electronic Engineering, Tsinghua
* May 2014 - Mar 2015   Key developer, of 3D re-player of 16th AI Programming Contest developed with Unity game engine, Tsinghua
* Mar 2013 - Mar 2013   Volunteer, Guiding high school students in their study and career choices, High School Affiliated to Nanjing Normal University

***

## Skills and Interests
* C, C++, Python, Matlab, R, C\#, Java, \LaTeX, SQL, Linux script, Verilog, x86 Assembly, MIPS, Pascal
* Caffe, Torch, sklearn, libsvm, OpenCV, OpenGL, OpenMP, MPI, CUDA, etc.
* Enjoy piano playing; Fond of classical music. Some of my [transcriptions].

***
